intro: Arthrosamanea daulensis, commonly known as the Daul's arthrosamanea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Cameroon and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
